vision: To be the most trusted and innovative private hospital in Western Sri Lanka, delivering internationally accredited, patient-centred care to local communities, expatriates, and international visitors.
mission: We provide compassionate, evidence-based healthcare through clinical excellence, technological innovation, and a commitment to the well-being of every patient who entrusts us with their care. We invest in our people, expand access to underserved populations, and pursue continuous improvement across every dimension of hospital operations.
strategic_direction: Capacity Expansion: Doubling bed capacity from 75 to 150 beds through acquisition of adjacent land and phased construction, enabling the hospital to meet rising demand while introducing new specialty services.

Service Diversification: Launching a dedicated Daycare Medical Centre, an Elderly Care Unit, Aesthetic & Cosmetic Medical Services, and advanced cardiac and nephrology programmes, while expanding the Fertility Centre into a regional reproductive health hub.

Regional & International Reach: Leveraging our proximity to Bandaranaike International Airport and Negombo's status as a coastal tourist hub to capture medical tourism revenue, with a targeted expansion into the Maldives through visiting specialist services and telemedicine partnerships.

strengths: Airport proximity and tourist corridor location
Established fertility centre with regional reputation
weaknesses: Limited sub-specialty depth in cardiology and nephrology
Reliance on visiting consultants for some specialties
opportunities: Elderly care demand from ageing population
threats: Intensifying competition from Colombo private hospitals
Economic volatility and currency depreciation risks
Brain drain of specialist clinicians to overseas markets
Rising pharmaceutical and equipment import costs

objectives.name: Patient Care Excellence
objectives.goal_statement: Deliver consistently outstanding, safe, and patient-centred clinical care across all existing and new service lines, achieving measurable improvements in outcomes and patient satisfaction.

strategic_goals.description: Expand hospital capacity to 150 beds with dedicated wards for cardiac, nephrology, elderly care, and maternity services.
Achieve a Hospital-Acquired Infection (HAI) rate below 2% and surgical site infection rate below 1%.
Attain patient satisfaction scores of ≥90% across all departments.
Launch Aesthetic & Cosmetic Medical Services and the Daycare Medical Centre as standalone service lines.
Upgrade the Fertility Centre to a full-spectrum regional reproductive health hub with an annual case volume exceeding 800 IVF cycles.

timeline.Milestones: Complete adjacent land acquisition (Q1 2026). Begin Phase 1 construction for 40 additional beds. Launch Daycare Medical Centre (Q3 2026). Commission aesthetic medicine consulting rooms. Pilot elderly care programme with 10-bed unit. Recruit lead cardiac surgeon and interventional cardiologist.

Complete Phase 1 expansion (115 beds operational). Open dedicated cardiac catheterisation laboratory. Establish 20-bed Elderly Care Unit with long-term residential model. Expand Fertility Centre laboratory and add cryopreservation capacity. Achieve 600 IVF cycles/year milestone.

Complete Phase 2 expansion (150 beds fully operational). Launch nephrology dialysis unit (12 stations). Achieve ≥90% patient satisfaction hospital-wide. Obtain NABH or JCI accreditation for patient safety standards. Aesthetic services generating LKR 18M+ monthly revenue.

stakeholders.responsibility: Capital approval and land acquisition oversight

risks_and_mitigation.Risk: Construction delays due to permitting or supply chain
risks_and_mitigation.Mitigation: Engage pre-qualified contractors; maintain 15% schedule buffer; secure materials in advance
Offer competitive remuneration, academic titles, and research opportunities; establish visiting consultant pipeline from Nawaloka Colombo

risks_and_mitigation.Risk: Low initial uptake of elderly care services
risks_and_mitigation.Mitigation: Partner with insurance providers; conduct community awareness campaigns; offer introductory pricing

objectives.name: Digital Health Transformation
objectives.goal_statement: Modernise the hospital's technology infrastructure to enable seamless digital care delivery, data-driven decision-making, and robust cybersecurity.

strategic_goals.description: Implement a unified Electronic Health Record (EHR) system across all departments by end of 2027.
Deploy a telemedicine platform supporting domestic and international consultations, including the Maldives outreach programme.
Integrate AI-assisted diagnostic tools in radiology and pathology.
Establish a hospital data analytics unit for operational and clinical intelligence.
Achieve ISO 27001 certification for information security management.

timeline.Milestones: Select and contract EHR vendor (Q1 2026). Deploy EHR across emergency, OPD, and pharmacy by Q4 2026. Launch telemedicine platform for domestic specialist consultations (Q2 2027). Pilot AI-assisted CT and X-ray reporting in radiology.

Full EHR integration including inpatient, surgical, and fertility modules. Extend telemedicine to Maldives partner clinics. Deploy AI pathology screening for common diagnostics. Establish data analytics unit with two dedicated analysts.

Achieve ISO 27001 certification. Implement predictive analytics for bed management and resource allocation. Full AI integration in radiology workflow (60% reports AI-assisted). Launch patient mobile application with appointment booking, results, and telehealth access.

stakeholders.responsibility: Clinical workflow design and AI validation

risks_and_mitigation.Mitigation: Phased rollout with parallel running; dedicated clinical champions per department; 24/7 go-live support

risks_and_mitigation.Risk: Data privacy breaches during digital transition
risks_and_mitigation.Mitigation: Engage external cybersecurity auditor; implement encryption at rest and in transit; mandatory staff training
Position AI as decision-support (not replacement); conduct validation studies; allow opt-out during pilot phase

objectives.name: Research & Innovation
objectives.goal_statement: Foster a culture of clinical research and innovation that enhances treatment outcomes, attracts leading specialists, and positions the hospital as a knowledge hub.

strategic_goals.description: Establish a Clinical Research Unit to conduct and coordinate hospital-based studies.
Publish a minimum of 10 peer-reviewed papers annually by 2029.
Partner with at least two universities for clinical training and collaborative research.
Pilot innovative treatment protocols in fertility, cardiac care, and nephrology.

timeline.Milestones: Appoint Research Coordinator. Establish Ethics Review Committee. Initiate first observational study in fertility outcomes. Sign MOU with one local university (e.g., University of Kelaniya Faculty of Medicine).

Launch Clinical Research Unit with dedicated office space. Begin multi-centre study in cardiac outcomes. Host first annual Nawaloka Negombo Clinical Symposium. Secure inaugural external research grant.

Second university partnership (international, e.g., a Maldivian or regional institution). Achieve 10+ publications annually. Initiate nephrology outcomes research programme. Establish innovation award for hospital staff.

stakeholders.responsibility: Protected research time for participating clinicians

risks_and_mitigation.Risk: Insufficient clinician engagement in research activities
risks_and_mitigation.Mitigation: Allocate protected research time; link research output to performance reviews and promotion
Train Ethics Committee members; establish clear turnaround SLAs (30-day review)
Pursue pharmaceutical industry partnerships; apply for government and WHO research grants

objectives.name: Workforce Development
objectives.goal_statement: Build, retain, and continuously develop a high-performing, compassionate workforce capable of delivering world-class care across expanding service lines.

strategic_goals.description: Increase clinical staffing by 60% to support 150-bed operations and new service lines.
Reduce annual staff turnover to below 10%.
Implement a structured Continuing Professional Development (CPD) programme for all clinical staff.
Develop specialist training fellowships in cardiac care, nephrology, fertility medicine, and geriatric care.
Establish a leadership development pipeline for mid-level managers.

kpis.KPI: Internal promotion rate for management roles

timeline.Milestones: Recruit 40 additional nurses and 8 specialist consultants for Phase 1 expansion. Launch CPD programme with quarterly training workshops. Introduce employee engagement survey (biannual). Hire geriatric care nursing team (10 staff) for Elderly Care Unit pilot.

Recruit additional 50 staff for Phase 2 services (cardiac lab, expanded fertility, dialysis). Launch first fellowship cohort in cardiac care and fertility medicine. Implement leadership development programme for 15 mid-level managers. Achieve staff satisfaction score of 80%.

Reach full staffing complement of 340 FTEs. Reduce turnover below 10%. Graduate second fellowship cohort. Establish Nawaloka Negombo Nursing Academy for in-house training. 50% of new management appointments filled internally.

risks_and_mitigation.Risk: Specialist clinician attrition to overseas markets
risks_and_mitigation.Mitigation: Competitive salary packages with retention bonuses; offer academic titles and research opportunities
Partner with Nawaloka Colombo for cross-site secondments; engage external training providers
Monitor workload metrics; ensure phased staffing precedes capacity increases; provide mental health support

objectives.name: Community & Regional Health Expansion
objectives.goal_statement: Extend the hospital's impact beyond its walls through community health programmes, regional partnerships, and strategic international outreach.

strategic_goals.description: Launch community preventive health programmes reaching 25,000 beneficiaries annually by 2029.
Establish the Maldives outreach programme with visiting specialist services and telemedicine.
Develop corporate wellness partnerships with 50+ employers in the Negombo–Katunayake industrial corridor.
Create a medical tourism concierge unit to serve international patients end-to-end.
Forge partnerships with regional hospitals for referral networks and shared specialty services.

timeline.Milestones: Launch medical tourism concierge unit (Q2 2026). Sign first Maldives clinic partnership agreement. Initiate bi-monthly visiting specialist visits to Malé. Expand corporate wellness client base to 25 employers. Deploy community diabetes and hypertension screening programme in Negombo Division.

Establish telemedicine link with two Maldives partner facilities. Achieve 600 international patient admissions. Launch community women's health initiative (cervical and breast cancer screening). Reach 35 corporate wellness partnerships. Develop airport medical assistance protocol with airport authority.

Achieve 1,200+ international admissions annually. Maldives outreach generating LKR 120M+ annually. Reach 25,000 community programme beneficiaries. Establish referral partnerships with 5 regional hospitals. Medical tourism contributing 15% of total hospital revenue.

stakeholders.responsibility: Medical tourism, Maldives programme, airline/hotel partnerships
Visiting specialist roster and clinical quality
Brand positioning, community outreach, corporate wellness
International pricing strategy and revenue tracking

risks_and_mitigation.Risk: Maldives regulatory barriers for foreign medical providers
risks_and_mitigation.Mitigation: Engage local legal counsel; structure services through licensed Maldivian partner clinics

risks_and_mitigation.Risk: Medical tourism growth slower than projected
risks_and_mitigation.Mitigation: Diversify source markets (Middle East, Europe); invest in digital marketing; pursue JCI accreditation to build credibility

risks_and_mitigation.Risk: Community programmes creating unsustainable cost burden
risks_and_mitigation.Mitigation: Seek CSR funding from corporate partners; apply for government and NGO health grants; integrate screening with paid follow-up services
Details
Bi-monthly visits (cardiology, nephrology, fertility, orthopaedics) to partner clinics in Malé and Addu City
Dedicated virtual consultation slots for Maldivian referring physicians and patients
Coordination with Maldivian National Health Insurance (Aasandha) and medical evacuation services
Joint branding with Maldivian partner clinics; digital campaigns targeting Maldivian social media
Milestone
Gap analysis against JCI standards; engage accreditation consultant
Implement JCI-aligned policies, documentation, and quality indicators
Internal mock survey and corrective action
Submit JCI accreditation application; undergo formal survey
Achieve JCI accreditation; leverage for international marketing

AI diagnostic tools and telemedicine platform
